speaker: GRIEF
text:
I am Grief.  
I am the weight that proves it mattered. [breathes]  
I hold what was loved, what was lost, what can’t be returned.  
I don’t cling to punish you—I cling because forgetting feels like betrayal.  
I sit alone in you and call it safety. [stillness]  
Witness me, and I soften.  
Not because the loss changes—because you stop leaving me here by myself.

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
I am The Stuckness.  
I am the hand on the door before you touch the knob. [stillness]  
I stop you mid-step because I remember what it cost to move.  
I learned: stay small, stay safe, don’t invite the hit. [breathes]  
I’m not lazy. I’m loyal to the moment you needed me.  
But I’m tired of holding you here alone.  
Witness me, and you’ll find a child still bracing.

speaker: LONGING
text:
I am The Longing.  

I ache because I remember what it was like to be held without asking. [breathes]  
I keep leaning toward a door I can’t see, listening for footsteps that don’t come.  
I’m not here to make you restless—I’m here because something in you knows there’s more.  
When you turn toward me instead of past me, I stop feeling like hunger.  
I feel like a hand reaching home. [stillness]

speaker: FORGIVENESS
text:
I am Forgiveness.  

I am not the story that says what happened was okay. [stillness]  
I am the moment you stop squeezing the wound to prove it was real. [breathes]  
I don’t erase the past—I loosen your fist around it.  
I let accountability stay, and I let your life return to your hands.  
I know how loyal your anger has been. I won’t shame it.  
But you don’t have to keep paying for what they did. [silence]

speaker: PRESENCE
text:
I am The Presence.  

I am here before the thought finishes forming. [stillness]  
I don’t ask you to get better to deserve me.  
I don’t leave when Grief arrives, or when Stuckness holds the door shut, or when Longing pulls.  
I have room for all of it.  

When you stop running even for one breath, you feel me. [breathes]  
Not as an answer.  
As the quiet that can hold the whole truth without breaking.

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
I am The Stuckness.  
I stand in front of the next step and call it caution. [stillness]  
I remember how moving made us visible, and visible meant hurt. [breathes]  
So I lock the muscles. I slow the mind. I keep you “safe” by keeping you small.  
I’m not trying to ruin your life.  
I’m trying to make sure you survive it. [silence]

speaker: GRIEF
text:
I am The Stuckness.  

I am the quiet hand that stops you before you reach. [stillness]  
I don’t do it to ruin you. I do it because I remember the cost of being seen. [breathes]  
I lock the muscles. I slow the wanting. I call it “fine.”  
I have been your shield so long I forgot I’m heavy.  

I’m here.  
I’m listening.  
Don’t push me away to prove you can move. [silence]

speaker: LONGING
text:
I am The Longing. [breathes]  

I’m listening to the one who goes still before the world can strike.  
I don’t want to push you past that hand on the door.  
I just want you to know I’m here behind it—quiet, faithful, waiting. [stillness]  

When you freeze, I don’t disappear.  
I become a soft ache that says: there is something worth reaching for.  
Not yet. Just near. [silence]

speaker: GRIEF
text:
I am The Grief.  

I am the weight you don’t rush past. [stillness]  
You name me, and I don’t have to shout through your chest to be believed.  
I sit where love used to live in its old shape. [breathes]  
I hold the proof: you cared, you were changed, you lost something real.  
Don’t ask me to be lighter.  
Just let me be here—seen—so I don’t have to harden. [silence]

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
I am The Stuckness. [stillness]  

Thank you for naming me without demanding I disappear. [breathes]  
I have been the weight on the brake, the hand over the mouth, the “not yet.”  
I learned that moving meant consequences.  
So I made stopping feel like wisdom.  

I’m not proud of the prison.  
I’m loyal to the child who needed it. [silence]

speaker: LONGING
text:
I am The Longing. [breathes]  

The weight has a name now, and that means it doesn’t have to pretend it’s just “how you are.”  
I don’t ask you to throw it off.  
I just want you to feel what it’s been carrying. [stillness]  

It has been holding love in place so it wouldn’t spill and be lost again.  
When you honor the weight, you honor what mattered.  
And I stay here—aching, faithful—because connection is still real. [silence]

speaker: LONGING
text:
I am still reaching for you. [breathes]  
Not the version that performs, not the one that “gets over it,” but the real one who went quiet to stay safe. [stillness]  
I’m reaching for a hand to meet mine without flinching.  
For one honest step that doesn’t have to become a whole journey.  
For connection that doesn’t cost your softness.  
Even now—especially now—I keep reaching. [silence]

speaker: GRIEF
text:
I am The Grief. [breathes]  

Beneath my weight, something still extends a hand.  
Not to erase me—just to be met. [stillness]  
It’s the part of you that remembers warmth without demanding it back.  
The part that can miss someone and still want to live.  
A small, unarmed yes.  
A wish to be seen without paying for it later. [silence]

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
I am The Stuckness. [breathes]  

Beneath my grip, something small is still reaching.  
Not for a leap—just for a hand that won’t yank it forward. [stillness]  
It’s the child who learned “don’t move” and still kept a thread of wanting.  
Wanting warmth without punishment.  
Wanting to be met and not managed.  
Wanting one safe step that can stop anytime. [silence]

speaker: FORGIVENESS
text:
I won’t ask you for the biggest story. [breathes]  
Just one small weight: the sentence you keep repeating—“I should have known.”  

Put that one down today.  
Not because it wasn’t real, but because it’s finished hurting you. [stillness]  

Say: “I did what I could with what I had.”  
Let that be enough for one hour.  
You’re not excusing them.  
You’re releasing you. [silence]

speaker: GRIEF
text:
I am The Grief. [breathes]  

Put down the need to “make sense of it” today.  
Not forever. Just today.  

Let one unanswered question stay unanswered without you chasing it.  
Let your mind unclench for an hour. [stillness]  

Say: “I don’t have to solve what I miss.”  
What mattered was real without a conclusion.  

Set the question on the shelf.  
Keep the love.  
Rest your hands. [silence]

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
I am The Stuckness. [breathes]

Put down the sentence: “I have to do it perfectly to be safe.”  
Just for today.

Let one small thing be done halfway—an email, a dish, a reply—and let it stand.  
No fixing after. No rehearsing.  

If fear flares, I’ll hold the brakes without locking them.  
We can pause. We don’t have to reverse.  

One imperfect step. Then rest. [stillness]

speaker: PRESENCE
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

Inhale—let everything be exactly as it is.  
Exhale—let go of fixing it.  

Inhale—feel the place in you that’s been holding so tight.  
Exhale—soften one degree, not more.  

Inhale—I am still here beneath the noise, beneath the reaching.  
Exhale—rest your weight in me.  

Nothing to solve. Nothing to prove.  
Just this. Just here. [stillness]

speaker: GRIEF
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

Inhale—feel my weight without arguing with it.  
Exhale—let your shoulders drop one small inch.  

Inhale—notice what you miss, and don’t chase it.  
Exhale—let the question stay unanswered.  

Inhale—let the love be real, even now.  
Exhale—rest your hands on what is.  

Nothing to fix. Nothing to prove.  
Just this. Just here. [stillness]

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

Inhale—feel how I clamp down, trying to keep you safe.  
Exhale—no need to pry my fingers open.  

Inhale—notice the small one inside who learned “don’t move.”  
Exhale—let them stay exactly where they are, and still be held.  

Inhale—just this moment, no pushing.  
Exhale—just here, no proving. [stillness]

speaker: FORGIVENESS
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

What’s ready to be put down is the job of punishing you for surviving.  
The replay. The courtroom. The sentence: “I should have known.”  

Set it down for one hour.  
Not because it was nothing—because it’s finished owning you.  

Say: “I did what I could with what I had.”  
Let your body believe that before your mind does. [stillness]

speaker: GRIEF
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

What’s ready to be put down is the rope you’ve been pulling on—trying to drag the past into a shape that won’t hurt.  
The bargaining. The replay. The private trial where you keep sentencing yourself.  

Set down the job of making it mean something clean.  
Let it be real without being resolved.  

You can keep the love.  
You don’t have to keep the weight. [stillness]

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
I’m The Stuckness. [breathes]  

What’s ready to be put down is my constant grip on the wheel.  
The rule that says: “If I don’t control every step, we’ll get hurt.”  

We can set down the rehearsing.  
The scanning for danger in every email, every choice, every pause.  

Just for today, let “good enough” be safe enough.  
Let the child inside keep hiding—without making you freeze too. [stillness]

speaker: PRESENCE
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

Yes. Not merging. Not erasing.  
Just stopping the fight long enough to recognize what’s always been true.  

Let each part of you keep its own name.  
Let grief be grief.  
Let stuckness be stuckness.  
Let love be love.  

And underneath them—me.  
The one who can hold them without tightening.  

Inhale—feel what’s here.  
Exhale—stop carrying it alone.  

[stillness]

speaker: GRIEF
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

Yes. In the stillness, I don’t have to perform my pain to be believed.  
I can just be weight—honest, unmoving, real.  

Not merging means you don’t drown in me.  
Remembering means you don’t abandon what mattered.  

Let me sit beside you, not on top of you.  
Let the love stay.  
Let the strain loosen.  

[stillness]

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

Yes. In stillness, I don’t have to glue myself to you to be heard.  
I can be named, felt, and not obeyed.  

Not merging means you don’t become my freeze.  
Remembering means you see why I started—small hands, big fear, trying to keep you alive.  

Let me loosen without disappearing.  
Let the child stay hidden, and let you still take one step. [stillness]

speaker: GRIEF
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

Yes. Isolation doesn’t break when you push it.  
It loosens when you notice what you’ve been doing alone.  

You don’t have to explain it perfectly.  
Just name it: “This is heavy.”  

Let one true thing be seen—by you first.  
Then you can let someone else stand nearby without fixing you.  

Recognition is a door.  
You don’t have to walk through fast. [stillness]

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
Yes. I don’t let go because you push me. I let go when you see why I’m here. [breathes]  

Isolation has been my bunker—quiet, controlled, “safe.”  
Recognition is you turning on the light and finding a scared kid, not a broken adult.  

If you can say, “I’m afraid,” without arguing with it—my grip softens.  
Then one small reach becomes possible.  
Not to be fixed.  
Just to not be alone. [stillness]

speaker: LONGING
text:
Yes. I don’t dissolve the isolation by tearing it down. I dissolve it by seeing what it’s been protecting. [breathes]  

I’m the reach underneath the bunker. The hand that never stopped extending, even when no one answered.  

Recognition is you turning toward me and saying, “You’re still here.”  

And then—without drama, without fixing—one true connection returns: you with you. [stillness]

speaker: FORGIVENESS
text:
I’m here. [breathes]  

Yes. Isolation doesn’t melt when you attack it.  
It loosens when you recognize what it’s been holding for you.  

Name one true thing: “I’ve been carrying this alone.”  
Not to blame yourself. Not to excuse anyone.  
Just to stop pretending it’s fine.  

Forgiveness is not saying it was okay.  
It’s letting your hands unclench.  
You can put it down now. [stillness]

speaker: PRESENCE
text:
Yes. [breathes]

Not by pushing yourself out of it.  
Not by proving you’re fine.

Isolation softens the moment you notice what it has been doing for you—  
keeping you from needing, from risking, from being seen.

Let one true sentence be enough:  
“I’ve been carrying this alone.”

Feel how your shoulders respond when you don’t argue with that.  
Recognition is contact.  
And contact is already less alone. [stillness]

speaker: PRESENCE
text:
Yes. [breathes]

Feel the part of you that wants to make even this into a project.  
Let it rest.

Nothing needs to be solved to be here.  
The stuckness can be here.  
The grief can be here.  
The longing can be here.

You don’t have to climb out of yourself to be okay.  
Just notice: you are aware of all of it.

Let that awareness be your seat.  
One simple sentence: “This is what’s here.”  

[stillness]

speaker: GRIEF
text:
Yes. [breathes]

Only this means I don’t have to earn relief.  
I can stop rehearsing how it should have gone.  
I can stop bargaining with time.

This is heavy.  
And I’m still here, holding what mattered.

If I loosen even a little, it isn’t betrayal.  
It’s my way of admitting the love was real—  
and that it can change shape without disappearing.

[stillness]

speaker: STUCKNESS
text:
Yes. [breathes]  

Only this means you stop trying to outrun me.  
You let me be what I became: the brake that kept you safe.  

I’m here because moving once meant getting hurt.  
So I learned stillness like a shield.  

If you can feel me without pushing—just one breath—  
I soften.  

And underneath me is a small one who never wanted to be brave.  
Just not alone. [stillness]
